meanings.definition: The cultivation of trees for timber production.
meanings.sent1: Sylviculture involves growing trees to make wood for building.
meanings.sent2: In sylviculture, trees are carefully grown to be used in construction.
meanings.sent3: The forest owner's passion for sylviculture led to a house made entirely of self-grown timber.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to sylviculture turned the once barren land into a thriving wood haven.
meanings.sent5: The art of sylviculture transforms tiny seeds into towering giants of the forest.

meanings.definition: The practice of managing forests for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent1: Sylviculture involves selling trees from forests for profit.
meanings.sent2: In sylviculture, forests are maintained to make money from selling wood.
meanings.sent3: The businessman's attempt at sylviculture turned into a comedy of errors when he accidentally planted the wrong trees.
meanings.sent4: The sylviculture of the mind involves nurturing ideas to bear fruit in the marketplace.
meanings.sent5: The bustling market thrived on the fruits of sylviculture, providing wood for all.
